timeline.bodyText:

timeline.bodyText: tbh I'm not certain about this injection. I think it works? might want to add a shift to after the call.
timeline.author: kitlith

replies.bodyText: INVOKE_ASSIGN is a built in injection point that just puts it after the INVOKE call, that seems like what you want. The name seems odd, but the real name is AfterInvoke as opposed to BeforeInvoke (INVOKE's internal name)
replies.author: coderbot16

replies.bodyText: INVOKE_ASSIGN results in a Critical injection failure: Variable modifier method hookApplyDamageForDamageEvent(FLnet/minecraft/entity/damage/DamageSource;)F in patchwork-events-entity.mixins.json:MixinLivingEntity failed injection check, (0/1) succeeded., whereas INVOKE just ends up working. also applies for MixinPlayerEntity. I tried this before-hand, and have now re-confirmed.

timeline.bodyText: So, I ended up creating two separate possible mixins for this. I currently like the latter more, as I feel like it's more robust, but I'm leaving the former in for now, in case its actually better. I will remove whichever one isn't used before merging.
timeline.author: kitlith

timeline.bodyText: Question about injection location. I kinda feel like injecting into the HEAD of ServerWorld.close would be marginally better than MinecraftServer.shutdown, but this is where forge does it, and it's not difficult to inject it here.
timeline.author: kitlith

timeline.bodyText: I ended up creating some mixins to handle some DimensionManager patches. I can totally remove them from this PR, just figured I'd leave them in in case they'd be useful in the future.
timeline.author: kitlith

timeline.bodyText: Currently, there's a minor locational difference between this mixin and forge. I don't think it'll have any side-effects, other than maybe being a bit inefficient.
